element.display: participant_id for father. 0 if not available

element.display: Other proband relationship not captured in enumeration above

target.display: Other proband relationship not captured in enumeration above

element.display: Biological sex assigned at birth (aligned with All of Us). If individual has a known DSD / not expected sex chromosome karyotype, this can be noted in the phenotype information section.

target.display: Biological sex assigned at birth (aligned with All of Us). If individual has a known DSD / not expected sex chromosome karyotype, this can be noted in the phenotype information section.

element.display: Optional free-text field to describe known discrepancies between 'sex' value (female is equal to >XX, male is equal to >XY) and actual sex chromosome karyotype

target.display: Optional free-text field to describe known discrepancies between 'sex' value (female is equal to >XX, male is equal to >XY) and actual sex chromosome karyotype

element.display: Additional specific ancestry description free text beyond what is captured by OMB race/ethnicity categories

target.display: Additional specific ancestry description free text beyond what is captured by OMB race/ethnicity categories

element.display: Age at last observation, aka age in years at the last time the center can vouch for the accuracy phenotype data. For conditions with later age of onset, this field lets users know if individuals marked as unaffected were younger or older than the age when the phenotype is expected to appear.

target.display: Age at last observation, aka age in years at the last time the center can vouch for the accuracy phenotype data. For conditions with later age of onset, this field lets users know if individuals marked as unaffected were younger or older than the age when the phenotype is expected to appear.

element.display: Indicate affected status of individual (overall with respect to primary phenotype in the family). Note: Affected participants must have entry in phenotype table.

target.display: Indicate affected status of individual (overall with respect to primary phenotype in the family). Note: Affected participants must have entry in phenotype table.

element.display: human-readable 'Phenotypic one-line summary' for why this individual is of interest. Could be the same as the term_details value in the Phenotype table. Strongly encourage/required for proband.

target.display: human-readable 'Phenotypic one-line summary' for why this individual is of interest. Could be the same as the term_details value in the Phenotype table. Strongly encourage/required for proband.
